35232142: Severe flooding in Newton Stewart and the Borders caused extensive damage, prompting calls for better flood defenses and faster response efforts, with ongoing repairs and disrupted travel.
40143035: Two tour buses carrying German and Chinese-Taiwanese groups were deliberately set on fire at a Northern Ireland hotel, destroying passengers' belongings and delaying their travel plans.
35951548: Mercedes secured pole position in Bahrain GP qualifying, with Hamilton narrowly beating Rosberg, while Ferrari's Vettel and Raikkonen showed strong pace but finished third and fourth.
36266422: John Bates, 67, denies 22 charges of child sexual abuse from 1972-1989 while he was a scout leader, with four male complainants alleging abuse in various locations.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation, but no hostages were taken.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a hard-fought victory over the Dragons with Simone Favaro scoring the decisive try in the final move, despite a messy and error-prone match.
20836172: A 31-year-old woman was killed and a man critically injured when a hit-and-run Audi struck them in London, with police seeking a suspect linked to the abandoned vehicle.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Antoine Demoitie, 25, died after a collision with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, sparking calls for improved safety measures in professional cycling.
40758845: Gundogan is recovering from a knee injury and optimistic about Manchester City's season, acknowledging Tottenham as strong title contenders.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash on the A127 in Essex, which closed the road for six hours as police investigated.
34615665: Hurricane Patricia, the strongest tropical storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959, raises questions about storm categories and their meanings.
35890902: Wireless mice from major brands are vulnerable to hacking due to unencrypted signals, allowing attackers to take control of PCs from up to 180m away, with some fixes now being released.
37922330: Murray and Burrell, a Galashiels-based business since 1928, went into administration, resulting in 38 job losses, though some workers may find employment with a nearby Melrose firm needing staff.
30844962: The European Commission suspects Luxembourg granted Amazon illegal state aid through a tax deal, but Amazon and Luxembourg deny any special treatment, with investigations ongoing.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day agricultural event in Northern Ireland, features local food, livestock competitions, and family activities, celebrating farming life and the Year of Food and Drink.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google to remove private sex party images from its search results, arguing privacy breach, while Google claims he no longer has a reasonable expectation of privacy.
38900884: Dragons' Eddie Jackson's injury is a setback but offers a chance for other players like Ollie Griffiths and Harrison Keddie to step up in the upcoming Pro12 match against Munster.
13890581: The UK government has secured three-year funding to support the endangered Cornish language, though long-term sustainability must come from local efforts in Cornwall.
40194700: Leonardo Jardim, Monaco's coach since 2014, calls his time at the club "exceptional," leading them to the 2016-17 Ligue 1 title and Champions League semi-finals, despite receiving other offers.
37903647: The U.S. criticized Nicaragua's election as unfair, citing opposition suppression and lack of observers, while Ortega's victory with 72.5% of the vote sparked protests and accusations of fraud.
13291223: South Africa forms a task team to address "corrective rape" after global pressure from 170,000 activists, aiming to classify it as a hate crime and improve protections for LGBTQ+ individuals.
36052570: Major oil producers meet to discuss freezing output amid market oversupply, while US stocks fall due to weak energy sector performance and disappointing economic data.
34944735: Tarantulas' vibrant blue color evolved independently at least eight times, likely for survival rather than mating, as they have poor color vision and don't use it in courtship.
32159602: Germanwings co-pilot Andreas Lubitz searched for suicide methods and cockpit security before intentionally crashing Flight 9525, killing all 150 on board.
34988915: Radio DJ Neil Fox denies multiple sexual assault charges, claiming workplace "horseplay" was consensual, while three accusers allege inappropriate behavior over decades.
37889203: Dele Alli will miss a few weeks after twisting his knee in training, ruling him out of England's upcoming matches and Tottenham's game against Arsenal.
33609927: A Jehovah's Witnesses uncle sexually abused his niece and another woman, but the organization's internal policies prevented justice until he was finally sentenced to 14 years in prison.
33578778: Former Greek finance minister Yanis Varoufakis criticized the EU bailout as a historic failure, while Greece faces strict reforms and austerity measures to secure the €86bn deal.
36888270: The IPC is investigating Russia's National Paralympic Committee over doping allegations, with a decision on a potential ban expected by early August.
36846007: Ben Earl, a 24-year-old former England under-20 international, joins the Exiles after six seasons with a north London side and Championship experience with Bedford Blues.
